contentExpanded.html: The Warriors have signed guard LJ Cryer to a two-way contract, it was announced Tuesday.
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors have signed guard LJ Cryer to a two-way contract, it was announced Tuesday.

contentExpanded.html: Cryer has appeared in seven games for the Santa Cruz Warriors this season, averaging 24.3 points, 4.9 rebounds and 6.1 assists in 34.0 minutes per game. He originally signed with the Warriors on September 29 before being waived on October 18. The guard appeared in five preseason games, averaging 5.0 points, 1.8 assists and 1.6 rebounds in 9.6 minutes per game.
contentExpanded.text: Cryer has appeared in seven games for the Santa Cruz Warriors this season, averaging 24.3 points, 4.9 rebounds and 6.1 assists in 34.0 minutes per game. He originally signed with the Warriors on September 29 before being waived on October 18. The guard appeared in five preseason games, averaging 5.0 points, 1.8 assists and 1.6 rebounds in 9.6 minutes per game.

contentExpanded.html: Unselected in the 2025 NBA Draft out of the University of Houston, Cryer competed against Warriors guard Will Richard in the 2025 NCAA Men’s Basketball National Championship, when Houston faced the Florida Gators.
contentExpanded.text: Unselected in the 2025 NBA Draft out of the University of Houston, Cryer competed against Warriors guard Will Richard in the 2025 NCAA Men’s Basketball National Championship, when Houston faced the Florida Gators.

contentExpanded.html:
The Warriors have waived forward Jackson Rowe, the team announced Monday.

Rowe originally signed a two-way contract with the Warriors on January 28, 2025, and tallied averages of 3.7 points, 1.8 rebounds and 8.7 minutes in six games last season.

In five games with the Santa Cruz Warriors this season, Rowe averaged 13.4 points, 8.4 rebounds, 2.0 assists and 1.4 blocks in 32.0 minutes.

contentExpanded.html:
The Warriors have signed free agent guard Seth Curry to a contract, it was announced Monday. Per team policy, terms of the agreement were not released. Curry was originally signed by the Warriors on October 1 and spent training camp with the Warriors before being waived on October 18.

Curry, 35, appeared in 68 games (14 starts) with the Charlotte Hornets last season, averaging 6.5 points and 1.7 rebounds in 15.6 minutes per contest while hitting a league-best 45.6% from 3-point range (83-of-182).
contentExpanded.text: The Warriors have signed free agent guard Seth Curry to a contract, it was announced Monday. Per team policy, terms of the agreement were not released. Curry was originally signed by the Warriors on October 1 and spent training camp with the Warriors before being waived on October 18.Curry, 35, appeared in 68 games (14 starts) with the Charlotte Hornets last season, averaging 6.5 points and 1.7 rebounds in 15.6 minutes per contest while hitting a league-best 45.6% from 3-point range (83-of-182).

video.name: seth-curry-warriors-introductory-press-conference-10-2-25
video.title: Seth Curry Warriors Introductory Press Conference | 10/2/25
video.excerpt: Seth Curry speaks to the media following Day 3 of Warriors 2025 Training Camp, Presented by Gatorade.

contentExpanded.html:
An 11-year NBA veteran, Curry has played in 550 games (224 starts) with the Hornets, Dallas Mavericks, Brooklyn Nets, Philadelphia 76ers, Portland Trail Blazers, Sacramento Kings, Phoenix Suns, Cleveland Cavaliers and Memphis Grizzlies, averaging 10.0 points, 2.0 rebounds and 1.9 assists in 22.5 minutes per game. The 6-1 guard owns career playoff averages of 11.6 points, 1.9 rebounds and 1.6 assists in 26.1 minutes over 41 games (16 starts) with the Nets, 76ers, Mavericks and Trail Blazers.

Unselected out of Duke University in the 2013 NBA Draft, Curry appeared in six games with Golden State during the 2013 preseason. He went on to play for the Golden State Warriors’ G League affiliate, the Santa Cruz Warriors, in 2013-14, appearing in 38 games (37 starts) and averaging 19.7 points (43.7 FG%, 37.2 3P%, 85.3 FT%), 3.1 rebounds, 5.8 assists and 1.4 steals in 34.7 minutes per game.

Curry will wear #31.

contentExpanded.html: Warriors guard De’Anthony Melton, who underwent surgery to repair a torn left ACL on December 4, 2024, continues to make good progress with his rehabilitation. He has fully participated in practice in recent days and continues to scrimmage in various settings. He will not play the remainder of this current homestand, but it is expected that he could be activated at some point during the team’s upcoming three-game road trip next week.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors will host the Minnesota Timberwolves on Friday, December 12, at Chase Center (7 p.m. PST) and will travel to Portland to face the Trail Blazers on Sunday, December 14 (6 p.m. PST), the NBA announced. Both games will be televised on NBC Sports Bay Area and air on 95.7 The Game.

Both games will be televised on NBC Sports Bay Area and air on 95.7 The Game.

contentExpanded.html: Tickets for the regular season home game on December 12 are available at warriors.com.
contentExpanded.text: Tickets for the regular season home game on December 12 are available at warriors.com.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors are one of 22 teams that did not qualify for the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup Quarterfinals and will play a pair of regular season games to complete the team’s 82-game schedule. Golden State finished the NBA Cup with a 1-3 record, finishing fifth in Group C.

contentExpanded.html: Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry, who exited last night’s game against the Houston Rockets with 35.2 seconds remaining in the fourth quarter due to a right quadriceps contusion, underwent an MRI late last night. The MRI confirmed a quadriceps contusion and muscle strain. He will be re-evaluated in one (1) week.

gameday-recap-20251126
items.title: Warriors Fall to Rockets in NBA Cup Finale
items.excerpt: The Golden State Warriors fell 104-100 against the Houston Rockets at Chase Center on Wednesday night in an Emirates NBA Cup matchup.

attributes.credit: Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/NBAE via Getty Images

featuredImage.credit: Photo by Jed Jacobsohn/NBAE via Getty Images

contentStructured.html: The Golden State Warriors fell 104-100 against the Houston Rockets at Chase Center on Wednesday night in an Emirates NBA Cup matchup.
contentStructured.text: The Golden State Warriors fell 104-100 against the Houston Rockets at Chase Center on Wednesday night in an Emirates NBA Cup matchup.

contentStructured.html: The Warriors led by as many as 14 points on the night, but a 27-17 third quarter advantage for the Rockets put them back in the game. Houston did not take their first lead of the game until the fourth quarter. Reed Sheppard scored a career-high 31 points for the Rockets.
contentStructured.text: The Warriors led by as many as 14 points on the night, but a 27-17 third quarter advantage for the Rockets put them back in the game. Houston did not take their first lead of the game until the fourth quarter. Reed Sheppard scored a career-high 31 points for the Rockets.

contentStructured.html: Jimmy Butler III scored a team-high 21 points for the Warriors. Rookie Will Richard recorded 18 points and six rebounds, while Brandin Podziemski added 14 points off the bench.
contentStructured.text: Jimmy Butler III scored a team-high 21 points for the Warriors. Rookie Will Richard recorded 18 points and six rebounds, while Brandin Podziemski added 14 points off the bench.

contentStructured.html:
PERFECT START
The Warriors got off to a blazing start on Wednesday, making their first five field goals of the night, including four 3-pointers. Jimmy Butler III scored the first six points of the game for the Warriors, hitting a pair of threes. Butler's first three came off taking Alperen Şengün off the dribble, and then hitting another to beat the shot clock.
contentStructured.text: PERFECT STARTThe Warriors got off to a blazing start on Wednesday, making their first five field goals of the night, including four 3-pointers. Jimmy Butler III scored the first six points of the game for the Warriors, hitting a pair of threes. Butler's first three came off taking Alperen Şengün off the dribble, and then hitting another to beat the shot clock.

contentStructured.html: For as great as the Warriors shooting was early, they went cold late. The Dubs shot 10-for-22 (45.5%) from 3-point range in the first half, but 2-for-21 (9.5%) in the second half.
contentStructured.text: For as great as the Warriors shooting was early, they went cold late. The Dubs shot 10-for-22 (45.5%) from 3-point range in the first half, but 2-for-21 (9.5%) in the second half.

contentStructured.html:
CLOSING THE HALF
The Warriors led 43-42 with 3:30 left in the second quarter, before closing on a 16-5 run to take a 12-point lead heading into halftime, capped off by Draymond Green's lay-up in the final seconds of the quarter.
contentStructured.text: CLOSING THE HALFThe Warriors led 43-42 with 3:30 left in the second quarter, before closing on a 16-5 run to take a 12-point lead heading into halftime, capped off by Draymond Green's lay-up in the final seconds of the quarter.

contentStructured.html:
CURRY, PAYTON LEAVE EARLY
Stephen Curry and Gary Payton II both left Wednesday's game early. Curry left the game with a quad injury, finishing the game with 14 points, six rebounds and five assists in 33 minutes of action.
contentStructured.text: CURRY, PAYTON LEAVE EARLYStephen Curry and Gary Payton II both left Wednesday's game early. Curry left the game with a quad injury, finishing the game with 14 points, six rebounds and five assists in 33 minutes of action.

contentStructured.html: Payton left the game in the second quarter with an ankle injury after five minutes of playing time.
contentStructured.text: Payton left the game in the second quarter with an ankle injury after five minutes of playing time.

contentStructured.html:
WARRIORS CUP GAMES
Wednesday marked the fourth and final group play game for the Warriors in the Emirates NBA Cup. With the Memphis Grizzlies win over the New Orleans Pelicans earlier on Wednesday, both the Warriors and Rockets were eliminated from the cup before their game completed. The Warriors will now have an additional two regular season games put on the schedule, the first on Dec. 11 or Dec. 12, and the second on Dec. 14 or Dec. 15. >> Buy Tickets to TBD Home Game
contentStructured.text: WARRIORS CUP GAMESWednesday marked the fourth and final group play game for the Warriors in the Emirates NBA Cup. With the Memphis Grizzlies win over the New Orleans Pelicans earlier on Wednesday, both the Warriors and Rockets were eliminated from the cup before their game completed. The Warriors will now have an additional two regular season games put on the schedule, the first on Dec. 11 or Dec. 12, and the second on Dec. 14 or Dec. 15. >> Buy Tickets to TBD Home Game

contentStructured.html:
WARRIORS CELEBRATE FITZ AND ROYE
The Golden State Warriors honored longtime broadcasters Bob Fitzgerald and Tim Roye during the game. Fitzgerald and Roye have spent 30-plus years chronicling Warriors’ basketball across television and radio. >> Read More
contentStructured.text: WARRIORS CELEBRATE FITZ AND ROYEThe Golden State Warriors honored longtime broadcasters Bob Fitzgerald and Tim Roye during the game. Fitzgerald and Roye have spent 30-plus years chronicling Warriors’ basketball across television and radio. >> Read More

contentStructured.html:
UP NEXT 
The Warriors continue their five-game homestand on Saturday night when they host the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, NBATV). The first 10,000 fans in attendance will receive a Kevon Looney commemorative pin, as it marks Looney's first game at Chase Center in an opposing team's uniform after 10 seasons with the Warriors and three NBA Championships.
contentStructured.text: UP NEXT The Warriors continue their five-game homestand on Saturday night when they host the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, NBATV). The first 10,000 fans in attendance will receive a Kevon Looney commemorative pin, as it marks Looney's first game at Chase Center in an opposing team's uniform after 10 seasons with the Warriors and three NBA Championships.

contentStructured.html: The Warriors will then meet the Oklahoma City Thunder at Chase Center on Tuesday, Dec. 2 (8 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, Peacock), the Thunder currently sit atop the NBA standings, led by reigning MVP and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.
contentStructured.text: The Warriors will then meet the Oklahoma City Thunder at Chase Center on Tuesday, Dec. 2 (8 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, Peacock), the Thunder currently sit atop the NBA standings, led by reigning MVP and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

contentExpanded.text: Payton left the game in the second quarter with an ankle injury after five minutes of playing time.

contentExpanded.html:
WARRIORS CUP GAMES
Wednesday marked the fourth and final group play game for the Warriors in the Emirates NBA Cup. With the Memphis Grizzlies win over the New Orleans Pelicans earlier on Wednesday, both the Warriors and Rockets were eliminated from the cup before their game completed. The Warriors will now have an additional two regular season games put on the schedule, the first on Dec. 11 or Dec. 12, and the second on Dec. 14 or Dec. 15. >> Buy Tickets to TBD Home Game
contentExpanded.text: WARRIORS CUP GAMESWednesday marked the fourth and final group play game for the Warriors in the Emirates NBA Cup. With the Memphis Grizzlies win over the New Orleans Pelicans earlier on Wednesday, both the Warriors and Rockets were eliminated from the cup before their game completed. The Warriors will now have an additional two regular season games put on the schedule, the first on Dec. 11 or Dec. 12, and the second on Dec. 14 or Dec. 15. >> Buy Tickets to TBD Home Game

contentExpanded.html:
WARRIORS CELEBRATE FITZ AND ROYE
The Golden State Warriors honored longtime broadcasters Bob Fitzgerald and Tim Roye during the game. Fitzgerald and Roye have spent 30-plus years chronicling Warriors’ basketball across television and radio. >> Read More
contentExpanded.text: WARRIORS CELEBRATE FITZ AND ROYEThe Golden State Warriors honored longtime broadcasters Bob Fitzgerald and Tim Roye during the game. Fitzgerald and Roye have spent 30-plus years chronicling Warriors’ basketball across television and radio. >> Read More

contentExpanded.html:
UP NEXT 
The Warriors continue their five-game homestand on Saturday night when they host the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, NBATV). The first 10,000 fans in attendance will receive a Kevon Looney commemorative pin, as it marks Looney's first game at Chase Center in an opposing team's uniform after 10 seasons with the Warriors and three NBA Championships.
contentExpanded.text: UP NEXT The Warriors continue their five-game homestand on Saturday night when they host the New Orleans Pelicans (5:30 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, NBATV). The first 10,000 fans in attendance will receive a Kevon Looney commemorative pin, as it marks Looney's first game at Chase Center in an opposing team's uniform after 10 seasons with the Warriors and three NBA Championships.

contentExpanded.html: The Warriors will then meet the Oklahoma City Thunder at Chase Center on Tuesday, Dec. 2 (8 p.m. PT; NBCSBA, Peacock), the Thunder currently sit atop the NBA standings, led by reigning MVP and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

data.title: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors

items.name: kuminga-melton-santos-recalled-20251126
items.title: Warriors Recall Jonathan Kuminga, De'Anthony Melton & Gui Santos From Santa Cruz
items.excerpt: The Golden State Warriors have recalled forward Jonathan Kuminga, guard De’Anthony Melton and forward Gui Santos from the team’s G League affiliate, the Santa Cruz Warriors.

contentStructured.html: The Golden State Warriors have recalled forward Jonathan Kuminga, guard De’Anthony Melton and forward Gui Santos from the team’s G League affiliate, the Santa Cruz Warriors, it was announced today.
contentStructured.text: The Golden State Warriors have recalled forward Jonathan Kuminga, guard De’Anthony Melton and forward Gui Santos from the team’s G League affiliate, the Santa Cruz Warriors, it was announced today.

contentStructured.html: Kuminga, who has missed the last six games due to bilateral knee patellar tendonitis, is averaging 13.8 points, 6.6 rebounds and 2.8 assists in 27.7 minutes over 13 games (12 starts) with Golden State this season.
contentStructured.text: Kuminga, who has missed the last six games due to bilateral knee patellar tendonitis, is averaging 13.8 points, 6.6 rebounds and 2.8 assists in 27.7 minutes over 13 games (12 starts) with Golden State this season.

contentStructured.html: Melton, who has yet to appear in a game with Golden State this season due to left ACL surgery, averaged 10.3 points, 3.3 rebounds, 2.8 assists, 1.4 steals and 20.2 minutes in six games (two starts) with the Warriors last season.
contentStructured.text: Melton, who has yet to appear in a game with Golden State this season due to left ACL surgery, averaged 10.3 points, 3.3 rebounds, 2.8 assists, 1.4 steals and 20.2 minutes in six games (two starts) with the Warriors last season.

contentStructured.html: Santos has appeared in 14 games (one start) with Golden State this season, averaging 2.6 points and 1.6 rebounds in 7.4 minutes per game.
contentStructured.text: Santos has appeared in 14 games (one start) with Golden State this season, averaging 2.6 points and 1.6 rebounds in 7.4 minutes per game.
